title: Simpson, Bama hold off Mizzou, win 5th straight
content: Ty Simpson threw for 200 yards and three touchdowns as eighth-ranked Alabama held off No. 14 Missouri 27-24 on Saturday to give the Crimson Tide their fifth consecutive win.

title: Cubs, Brewers each starting relievers for Game 5
content: The Cubs announced that left-hander reliever Drew Pomeranz would start Saturday's Game 5 while the Brewers are turning to right-hander Trevor Megill, their All-Star closer.

title: Haaland misses 2 pens, still gets Norway hat trick
content: Manchester City star Erling Haaland twice missed a penalty for Norway against Israel, but still wound up with a hat trick in a 5-0 World Cup qualifying win on Saturday.

title: Falcons rule WR Mooney out vs. Bills on Monday
content: Falcons No. 2 wide receiver Darnell Mooney has been ruled out for "Monday Night Football" against the Bills because of a hamstring injury.

title: Stanford CB Morris OK after leaving in ambulance
content: Stanford cornerback Aaron Morris was cleared medically to return to the sideline against SMU after being immobilized and taken off the field in an ambulance following a tackle in the first quarter.

title: Tibbetts: Ejection in closeout G4 'weak,' unmerited
content: Mercury coach Nate Tibbetts was critical of his ejection late in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals, calling it "one of the weakest double technicals ever."

title: Commanders rule out receivers McLaurin, Brown
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn has ruled out wide receivers Terry McLaurin (quad) and Noah Brown (groin/knee) for Monday's game against the Bears, while Deebo Samuel (heel) is uncertain to play.

title: Gauff, Pegula to square off in first final matchup
content: Coco Gauff had more struggles with her serve but overcame seven double faults to beat Jasmine Paolini, while Jessica Pegula ended Aryna Sabalenka's multiyear winning streak at the Wuhan Open.

title: üèÄ How A'ja Wilson reached GOAT status
content: Wilson has been called a lot of things this postseason: an elk, a shark, a lion. But is it time to call her the GOAT?

title: Odds, X factors and how the Mariners and Blue Jays can reach the World Series
content: It's the AL's top two seeds for a trip to the Fall Classic. Here's your first look at how Seattle and Toronto stack up.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Gamrot end Oliveira's unbeaten streak in Brazil?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: The three stars who made the Aces three-time WNBA champs
content: Las Vegas won on the shoulders of A'ja Wilson, Chelsea Gray and Jackie Young. The trio has no plans to stop.

title: NFL predictions, fantasy sleepers, trends for Week 6: Keep an eye on Sam Darnold?
content: Could Darnold be a fantasy sleeper? Can the Chiefs' defense stop the Lions' play-action? Here's last-minute intel for Week 6.

title: What's wrong with Liverpool: Transfers? Salah? Fixtures?
content: Liverpool have lost three games in a row in all competitions, having spent ¬£450m over the summer, but what are some of the factors behind their slump?

content: Man United haven't had sustained Premier League success in more than a decade. Here's what they need to do.

title: Don't be surprised if... McMillan finds end zone, Judkins finishes top 3 in rushing
content: Week 6 storylines include a pair of impressive rookies, and is the Mayfield/Egbuka connection sustainable?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks, plus projected scores for every game.

title: 'Basically playing for pizza': Remembering Sean Payton's six-month run as the QB of the Leicester Panthers
content: Before he became a Super Bowl-winning coach, Payton played quarterback on an English team alongside bouncers and construction workers.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è QB-needy Bengals land Flacco in Browns trade
content: The Bengals turned to their division rivals for a much-needed solution at quarterback, acquiring Joe Flacco in a trade with the Browns.

title: üèÄ Collier, Engelbert and WNBA teetering on brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: üí∞ Former player donates $50M to Stanford football
content: The Stanford football program received a $50 million gift from a former player, the school announced Wednesday, marking a significant donation as it attempts to revive the fortunes of the program under general manager Andrew Luck.

title: üî• How Roki Sasaki became Dodgers' 100 mph reliever
content: After a disastrous MLB debut, L.A.'s new ninth-inning man has unleashed jaw-dropping stuff in October. Here's what fueled the sudden turnaround.

title: üèÄ Giannis has finally put the Bucks on the clock
content: In a transformative summer for the Bucks, the team had discussions about moving the two-time MVP to New York.

title: üçª LeBron raises glass in latest 'decision'
content: LeBron James teased a second "decision," which turned out to be an ad for Hennessy, the cognac brand with which James has been a longtime partner. The announcement prompted a boost in ticket prices for the Lakers' last regular-season game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter Miami eye Messi, Su√°rez, Neymar reunion
content: Inter Miami could reunite former Barcelona pair Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez with Neymar in a blockbuster move. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Impending free agents, aging stars and an injured ace: How much longer can the Phillies keep contending?
content: This October brought another early exit for a Philly squad with World Series aspirations. Where does the team go from here?

title: Four ways LeBron James' unprecedented 23rd NBA season could go
content: Retirement? Re-up with the Lakers? Request a trade? Here are the various pathways for LeBron and the Lakers for the 2025-26 campaign.

title: Why did CFB move its transfer portal? What do coaches think? Is tampering a problem?
content: The NCAA officially moved its football transfer portal to January, but not without questions. We have answers.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Wirfs witnessed Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Reese to become first professional athlete to walk in Victoria's Secret Fashion Show
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Cheat sheet: 2025-26 NBA player rankings, schedule grid, more
content: Here is all of our key fantasy basketball draft content -- rankings, sleepers, schedule grid and draft tips -- collected into downloadable/printable PDF cheat sheets.

title: Balancing Islamabad: Why India‚Äôs Kabul outreach matters now - the Afghan comeback explained
content: India is upgrading its Kabul mission to a full embassy, signaling a significant diplomatic shift during Taliban Foreign Minister Muttaqi's visit. This move, without formal recognition, aims to enhance regional stability and counter terrorism. Muttaqi also strongly condemned Pakistan's alleged bombing of civilian areas in Afghanistan, highlighting a growing rift between Kabul and Islamabad.

title: Party was 'picture perfect' - until it wasn't: US school chief recounts shooting horror; 4 dead
content: A peaceful homecoming celebration in Leland, Mississippi, turned tragic Friday night when gunfire erupted, killing four adults and injuring at least 12 others. The violence broke out during a community block party following a high school football game and tailgate. Officials are investigating the incident, which has devastated the small, low-crime town.

title: US military plant explosion: ‚ÄòNo survivors‚Äô in Tennessee blast; at least 18 presumed dead
content: A massive explosion at a military explosives plant in Tennessee has resulted in no survivors found, with at least 18 people feared dead. Recovery efforts are underway at the Accurate Energetic Systems facility in McEwen, where the blast destroyed a building and scattered debris. The cause remains unknown, and the site is considered volatile.

title: 'China using these gadgets to spy on Americans', says FCC; issues security notice
content: The FCC has issued a national security notice, warning that Chinese electronics pose a surveillance and security threat to Americans. Millions of prohibited product listings, including security cameras and smartwatches from companies like Huawei and Hikvision, have been removed from US retail platforms. This action is part of Washington's ongoing crackdown on Chinese technology firms due to national security concerns.

title: 'Indians' success in US no conspiracy': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: Who is Valentin Vacherot‚Äôs girlfriend Emily Snyder? Meet the American cheering him on
content: Valentin Vacherot, a qualifier, is in the Shanghai Masters semifinals. His girlfriend, Emily Snyder, is his constant support. This is Vacherot's biggest career moment. He will face Novak Djokovic next. Snyder's presence helps him stay calm and confident during matches. This run marks a significant achievement for the young player.

title: Earthquake jolts Pakistan: 5.0 magnitude quake strikes, second in a week
content: Pakistan experienced a 5.0 magnitude earthquake on Saturday evening at a shallow depth of 10 km, raising concerns about potential aftershocks. This marks the second tremor in October for the seismically active region. While no immediate damage or casualties were reported, the shallow nature of the quake increases ground shaking intensity.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: IND vs WI: Jadeja faces difficult IND-AUS series axe query - 'Why didn't I get selected?'
content: Ravindra Jadeja has been excluded from the ODI squad for the Australia tour. He has communicated with the team management about this decision. Jadeja remains committed to performing for India whenever given an opportunity. He prioritizes team victories over personal milestones. Jadeja is also serving as vice-captain for the ongoing Test series against West Indies.

title: Ayesha Curry‚Äôs marriage confession sparks backlash as NFL star Cam Newton steps in
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faced fan backlash for her candid remarks about not initially wanting marriage or children. Despite criticism, she received support from figures like Cam Newton, who praised her honesty.  Others, including Gilbert Arenas and Stephen himself, have rallied behind her, highlighting the misunderstanding of her sentiments.

title: Jaz Elle‚Äôs one-word reply melts hearts on Agassi‚Äôs iconic style
content: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: Mark Sanchez altercation video shows troubling behavior before arrest
content: Former NFL star Mark Sanchez faced arrest in Indianapolis. Shocking video shows him disoriented before a violent clash. He allegedly confronted a delivery driver, leading to a struggle. The driver used pepper spray and a knife in self-defense. Sanchez faces felony charges. Toxicology results are awaited as the investigation continues.

title: History created: In first-ever clash! South Africa fall to Namibia
content: Namibia achieved a historic four-wicket victory over South Africa in the inaugural international match at the new Namibia Cricket Ground. Wicketkeeper Zane Green's unbeaten 30, including crucial runs in the final overs, sealed the win. The match marked a significant moment for Namibian cricket, especially with the ground set to host the 2027 Cricket World Cup.

title: Biden‚Äôs cancer battle: Ex-US president undergoing radiation, hormone therapy
content: Former US President Joe Biden is undergoing radiation and hormone treatments for prostate cancer, diagnosed in May. The 82-year-old's office previously revealed an aggressive diagnosis that had spread to his bones. This news emerged following concerns about his health during his presidential campaign.

title: Taliban FM visits Darul Uloom Deoband. What‚Äôs its connection to Afghanistan? Explained
content: Taliban's foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi visited Darul Uloom Deoband, expressing optimism for improved India-Afghanistan ties and highlighting educational and cultural connections. The seminary's president reassured that Afghanistan would not be used for terror against India. This visit underscores the historical and religious links between the two nations.

title: New pandemic coming? Japan declares nationwide flu outbreak; over 4000 hospitalised
content: Japan is facing a nationwide flu outbreak. Cases have surged significantly, leading to hospitalizations and school closures. This epidemic has arrived nearly five weeks earlier than expected. Health officials are urging immediate vaccination for vulnerable groups. Experts suggest this early start may become more common due to global environmental changes. Precautions like mask-wearing and handwashing are advised. Read more below!

title: Bihar elections: Legacy, loyalty & new rivalry ‚Äî Why Raghopur could decide the next chapter
content: Bihar's political landscape is shifting as Lalu Yadav and Nitish Kumar near the end of their careers. The upcoming elections might see a new era, with Tejashwi Yadav and Prashant Kishor potentially clashing in Raghopur, a traditional RJD stronghold. This contest could redefine Bihar's political future.

title: Watch: Never seen before! WWE star Reigns turns Kohli inside ring
content: Roman Reigns shocked WWE fans at Crown Jewel 2025 by using a bat against Bronson Reed, reminiscent of a cricket match. This daring move followed Reigns's loss to Reed in an Australian Street Fight, where he was double-teamed and ultimately defeated by Reed's Tsunami. Reigns's return on Raw set up this rematch, but Reed once again secured a significant victory.

title: US school campus shooting: 4 dead, 12 injured in Mississippi; attacker at large
content: Tragedy struck Leland, Mississippi, early Saturday as a shooting during homecoming weekend claimed four lives and injured at least twelve. Crowds gathered on the main street for the high school festivities when the violence erupted. Authorities are actively investigating the incident, with the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation assisting local efforts.

title: Haryana IPS 'suicide': ADG‚Äôs wife accuses cops of diluting charges; DGP, SP 'not named in FIR'
content: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, Haryana IAS officer Amneet Kumar, has flagged discrepancies in the FIR registered following his suicide. She insists accused individuals, including senior police officials, are not clearly named and alleges dilution of SC/ST Act charges. Kumar also seeks copies of her husband's final note for verification.

title: IND vs WI: Jaiswal put under pressure; asked to chase 'Sehwag ka 300 wala record'
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal continued his impressive Test form with a brilliant 175 against the West Indies in Delhi. His innings, a blend of patience and elegance, featured a significant partnership with B Sai Sudharsan. Jaiswal's consistent big hundreds are drawing comparisons to cricketing legends, with predictions of him breaking records.

title: 'Trump considers Modi as great & personal friend': US ambassador-designate meets PM ‚Äî Key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Modi met US Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor, signaling renewed focus on the India-US partnership amidst trade tensions. Gor highlighted President Trump's "great" regard for Modi and discussed strengthening bilateral ties in defense, trade, and technology. The meeting, following a recent Trump-Modi phone call, aims to boost economic collaboration and regional stability.

title: 'Mamata must go': Political row erupts as another 'gang rape' evokes RG Kar horror
content: A medical student was allegedly gang-raped in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district, sparking a political row. The BJP accused the state government of appeasement policies leading to a "nightmare for women's safety." West Bengal minister Shashi Panja urged the BJP not to politicize the crime and expressed faith in the ongoing investigation.

title: 'Fog won‚Äôt help terrorists': BSF's winter warning to Pak; India all set 'to foil infiltrations'
content: Border Security Force is ready for winter in the Jammu sector.  They will stop Pakistan-based terrorists from infiltrating.  Intelligence indicates terror groups are regrouping.  The BSF is on high alert.  They will respond to any attempts to push terrorists into India.  Modern warfare technology is being used.  The BSF is training its personnel to counter enemy drones.

title: 2nd Test: Gill‚Äôs 129 powers India; Jadeja spins Windies into trouble
content: India's spinners have taken control of the second Test against the West Indies. Captain Shubman Gill scored an impressive century, setting a strong foundation. The West Indies are trailing significantly after losing four wickets. Ravindra Jadeja claimed three wickets, putting India in a commanding position to win the series. The Indian team displayed excellent batting and bowling throughout the day.

title: 'No matter how influential...' Haryana CM vows action in IPS 'suicide' case
content: Haryana CM assures strict action against anyone found guilty in IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's suicide probe, regardless of influence. The deceased officer's wife expressed dissatisfaction with the FIR, citing missing names and incomplete details, and requested corrections. She also alleged dilution of SC/ST Act charges and sought copies of crucial notes.

title: Clashes rock Pakistan: Police fire on Gaza protesters - what we know so far
content: Hardline Islamist group Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) protests turned violent across Pakistan, resulting in at least 11 deaths and dozens injured. Demonstrators marched towards Islamabad in solidarity with Palestinians, clashing with police who used tear gas and barricades. The TLP, known for disruptive protests, faced government warnings against further marches.

title: 'PM not bigger than country': Owaisi's latest on Op Sindoor delegation‚Äî Watch
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi stated he joined the Operation Sindoor delegation for the country, not the Prime Minister, emphasizing national unity against terrorism. He highlighted India's stance against Pakistan-linked terror, sharing data on attacks. Separately, AIMIM plans to contest around 100 seats in Bihar's upcoming assembly elections, aiming to form a 'third alternative'.

title: Indian states men prefer to work in: Gujarat leads; check top 10 here
content: The India Skills Report 2025 reveals rising employability among men, reaching 53.46% in 2025. Male professionals prefer working in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Haryana. These states offer career growth, infrastructure, and supportive ecosystems. Employers can use this insight for recruitment, while men can align career choices with high-opportunity regions.

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 doctors in a year when 80k graduated
content: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: Barefoot & displaced, Palestinians return ‚Äî What post-ceasefire Gaza looks like
content: Thousands of displaced Palestinians returned to Gaza's shattered north as a US-brokered ceasefire took effect, with Israeli troops beginning to withdraw. Families navigated rubble to reach ruined homes, marking a bittersweet return amid a new peace plan involving troop withdrawal and hostage swaps.

title: As LPG truckers‚Äô stir continues, OMCs take steps to ease supply
content: Indian Oil, Hindustan Petroleum, Bharat Petroleum are operating extra shifts at bottling plants and are working on Sundays; distributors allay fears of shortage; Bulk LPG Transport Owners Association continue talks with senior officials of OMCs

title: Media bodies condemn ‚Äòexclusion‚Äô of women journalists in Afghan Minister‚Äôs press conference
content: The Opposition too termed the absence of female journalists from Amir Khan Muttaqi‚Äôs presser ‚Äòunacceptable‚Äô and ‚Äòan insult to women‚Äô as they asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to clarify his position on the matter

title: Malappuram municipality clears 2-decade-old dump
content: The civic body reclaimed five acres by removing nearly 11,000 cubic metre waste dumped in the past two decades by spending ‚Çπ11.40 crore under the Kerala Solid Waste Management Project

title: Jay Dholakia, son of former BJD Minister, joins BJP
content: The BJD may have nominated Jay Dholakia to capitalise on the sympathy factor following his father‚Äôs death

title:
A.P. govt. aims to create 1 lakh entrepreneurs 
from MEPMA, DWCRA groups, says CM
content: 120 state-of-the-art shops have been set up within 30 modular containers in the Smart Street Vending Market in Nellore at a cost of ‚Çπ 7 crore, he says

title: Government committed to implementing pro-farmer programmes: A.P. Agriculture Minister
content: New initiatives like PM Dhan Dhaanya Krishi Yojana and Pulses Self-Reliance Mission will boost farmers‚Äô economic empowerment and ensure protein security through increased pulse production, says Atchannaidu

title: Take up rainwater harvesting to ensure long-term water security in villages, says Stalin at gram sabha meeting
content: He advised local body representatives to ensure basic services such as water supply and electricity are not affected during rain and to form committees comprising social groups and local residents to plan in advance for the monsoon

title: Art forms nurtured Tamil language, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: The Dravidian movement has promoted Tamil music, writing, and theatre; it enriched the language on public platforms and reformed society, says Stalin while conferring Kalaimamani awards; he urges artists from the State to spread Tamil art forms and culture throughout the world

title: Social and Educational Survey: Digital divide leaves senior enumerators struggling
content: While younger enumerators are able to navigate tech issues more easily, senior enumerators lament that they have limited familiarity with digital systems

title: With oral morphine solution inaccessible in districts, hundreds come to Kidwai every month¬†
content: It has been over 10 years since Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985, was amended in 2014 to streamline the process for medical use of oral morphine and its access to those in need

title: U.S. Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor in Delhi, meets PM Modi, Jaishankar, Doval, and Misri
content: U.S. envoy Gor‚Äôs visit has raised speculation that he is in New Delhi to firm up details for a meeting between Mr. Trump and Mr. Modi on the sidelines of the upcoming ASEAN-related summits in Kuala Lumpur

title: Police stop Congress leaders from visiting Rae Bareli lynching victim‚Äôs family
content: State unit president Ajay Rai and others were stopped right outside the party office; they vow to continue to support Valmiki‚Äôs family

title: Unease in Congress State unit over delay in seat sharing for Bihar polls
content: Leaders of the Opposition bloc‚Äôs partner Congress say they were getting ‚Äòrestive and unnerved‚Äô while pointing out that the party should emerge out of the political shadow of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Bihar to contest solo

title: Trinamool claims Tamil Nadu‚Äôs new outreach scheme inspired by Bengal initiative
content: Party says Tamil Nadu‚Äôs ‚ÄòNamma Ooru, Namma Arasu‚Äô modelled on West Bengal‚Äôs ‚ÄòAmader Para, Amader Samadhan‚Äô participatory governance programme

title: Watch: ‚ÄúBJP is nothing without Nitish Kumar‚Äù : Pappu Yadav exclusive
content: Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav, is a six-time MP from Bihar who currently represents the constitituency of Purnea, in the State‚Äôs border areas, as an Independent MP in the Lok Sabha

title: DKS announces ‚Çπ10-crore grant to develop Lalbagh to implement plans suggested by citizens
content: The issues revolve around familiar civic problems such as garbage accumulation, potholes, property clearance delays, inadequate parking, poor infrastructure maintenance, and civic officials‚Äô apathy toward citizens

title: Crime Branch registers a case of ‚Äúmisappropriation‚Äù of  Sabarimala temple artefacts
content: The agency names 11 persons, including Unnikrishnan Potti, as suspects. Offences include confidence trickery, cheating, conspiracy, theft and possible violation of the Prevention of Corruption Act

title: Telangana Prisons Department expands legal aid access and digital reform initiatives
content: Department focusing on reform-oriented correctional policies aimed at reformation, rehabilitation and reintegration of inmates

title: India, Canada Trade Ministers Discuss Ways To Strengthen Economic Ties
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday held discussions with his Canadian counterpart Maninder Sidhu on ways to strengthen economic ties between the two countries.

title: "Yet To Hear From Singapore Officials": Police On Zubeen Garg Death Probe
content: Assam Police were yet to hear from Singaporean authorities on their request for information regarding cultural icon Zubeen Garg's death in the Southeast Asian nation while swimming in the sea last month, a senior officer said here on Saturday.

title: IndiGo To Start Direct Flights From Delhi To China, Vietnam From November 10
content: Expanding its international network, IndiGo will start flights from the national capital to Guangzhou in China and Hanoi in Vietnam from November 10.

title: Bihar Man Wanted To Marry Girlfriend, So He Set Second Wife Ablaze
content: A man in Bihar wanted to marry his girlfriend, but his second wife objected. Angered by this, he doused her in petrol, released LPG, and set her ablaze, officials said on Saturday.

title: Class 9 Student Dies During Sports Event In Private School In Kolkata
content: A class 9 student of a private international school in the southern fringes of the city died during a sports event on the school ground, a police officer said on Saturday.

title: Bihar's Migrant Workers In Tamil Nadu Unlikely To Travel Home To Vote
content: Travelling over 2,000 km from Tamil Nadu to exercise their franchise during the two-phase elections in early November remains a distant dream for many migrant workers from Bihar, as their insecure jobs make it nearly impossible to take time off.

title: India's Trade With European Countries To Raise $100 Billion In Investments, Create 1 Million Jobs
content: India's trade landscape marked a historic milestone as the India-European Free Trade Association Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement, signed on March 10, 2024, officially came into effect on October 1, 2025.

title: Top Court To Rule On Pleas Seeking Independent Probe Into Karur Stampede
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to pronounce its order on October 13 on a batch of pleas seeking an independent investigation into the Karur stampede incident in which 41 people lost their lives.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Speaks With Dead Cop's Family, Assures Justice
content: In his first public comments over a case involving an IPS officer's "suicide", Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini assured the cop's family members on Saturday that they will get justice.

title: 'Heinous Aggression': Lebanon Slams Overnight Israeli Strike On Civilian Sites
content: Lebanese President Joseph Aoun on Saturday condemned an overnight Israeli strike on civilian sites, which reportedly killed at least one person and which Israel said targeted Hezbollah infrastructure.

title: 'Like You Did In Middle East': Zelensky Asks Trump To Broker Ukraine Truce
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky urged Donald Trump to broker peace in Ukraine like he did in the Middle East during a phone call on Saturday.

title: Cleric's Wife, 2 Daughters Murdered On Mosque Premises In UP
content: The wife and two minor daughters of a Muslim cleric were found murdered with a sharp-edged weapon inside their residence in a village here on Saturday, police said.

title: Madhya Pradesh Crime Thriller: Cash Seizure, 50-50 Deal, Police Suspensions
content: The Madhya Pradesh Police force is in a bind as it faces heat over a corruption scandal involving cops.

title: 'Kill Wild Boar, Eat Their Meat': Kerala Minister's Solution For Crop Damage
content: Kerala Agriculture Minister P Prasad on Saturday claimed the growing menace of wild boars destroying crops could be tackled more effectively if people were allowed to consume their meat.

title: 'Teachers' Recruitment To Start Immediately If We Win': Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday said the process for holding the teachers' recruitment exam (TRE-4) would be immediately initiated if the Mahagathbandhan is voted to power in the state.

title: After Manipur's Iconic Building Razed, A Renovation vs Reconstruction Row
content: The Manipur government has clarified that an iconic old building in Shillong linked to Manipur's history, whose demolition sparked protests on Friday, will be reconstructed by retaining the original architectural design.

title: Rajasthan Man, In Contact With Pakistani 'Handler', Arrested For 'Spying'
content: Police have arrested a man from the Alwar district of Rajasthan on charges of spying for Pakistan's intelligence agency, ISI.

title: Singer Kumar Sanu Approaches Delhi High Court Seeking Protection Of Personality Rights
content: Singer Kumar Sanu has approached the Delhi High Court, seeking protection of his personality and publicity rights, including his name, voice, vocal style and technique.

title: JDU Ex-MP Who Once Threatened To 'Break Nitish Kumar's Ribs' Rejoins Party
content: Former Jehanabad MP Arun Kumar, who had for some time been a bitter critic of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, on Saturday returned to the JD(U).

title: On Tejashwi Yadav's Turf, Prashant Kishor's "He Should Be Worried" Remark
content: Jan Suraaj founder and political strategist-turned-political leader Prashant Kishor made a high-profile visit to the Raghopur Assembly constituency on Saturday.

title: Palakkad‚Äôs cultural community unite to condemn Israeli ‚Äòaggression‚Äô on Gaza
content: The event featured a variety of performances: sketches telling Palestinian struggles, poetry recitals and plays depicting Gaza‚Äôs plight under Israeli conflict.

title: Pawan Singh rules out contesting Bihar Assembly election
content: Bhojpuri actor-singer says he will continue to serve as a ‚Äòsoldier‚Äô of the BJP amid speculation over possible candidature

title: Karnataka expanding automated vehicle testing stations to enhance transparency in fitness checks
content: Once these centres become operational, all vehicles seeking renewal of their fitness certificates will be required to undergo testing exclusively at the ATS.

title: True care emerges only from a heart that feels another‚Äôs pain: Sara Joseph
content: At World Hospice and Palliative Care Day observance in Thrissur, author Sara Joseph calls for greater empathy and collective reflection on dignified end-of-life care

title: Champions Boat League to begin on Oct. 12
content: The Kerala Tourism-organised Champions Boat League, modelled after the IPL, will take place along the Chaliyar river; Tourism Minister will inaugurate the event, which features 15 boats racing along the course between the old Feroke bridge and the new bridge

title: Munambam HC verdict leads to legal quandary in Kerala
content: Notwithstanding the High Court decision, the Waqf tribunal will have to go ahead with its proceedings in the case, as it is the only jurisdictional forum to decide on the registration of the Waqf and related matters

title: West Bengal records highest number of crimes committed by foreigners: NCRB data
content: This data assumes significance amidst ongoing political developments in the State, with the Opposition in West Bengal alleging a high degree of ‚Äòinfiltration‚Äô by Bangladeshi nationals and making that their poll plank for next year‚Äôs Assembly election

title: Public irked as Kerala govt.‚Äôs citizen portal drops e-application feature
content: Users can no longer submit complaints directly to government departments or generate acknowledgements as proof of submission through the portal

title: Indian, EU officials optimistic about closing trade deal this year

title: J&K accidents: Kathua teen dies in hit-and-run; 10 injured in Kishtwar landslide
content:
Representative image

JAMMU: A 17-year-old girl died after being hit by an unknown vehicle in Kathua on Friday night while at least 10 people were injured when their vehicle was hit by a landslide at Sigdi Balana area of Kishtwar district on Saturday, police said. Police said the victim in the first accident, Kritika Pansotra, was the daughter of one Ram Pal from Kathua. She was found lying by the roadside after her scooty was hit by an unidentified vehicle. ‚ÄúThe girl was taken to GMC Kathua, where doctors declared her ‚Äòbrought dead‚Äô,‚Äù police said. In the second accident, 10 people were injured after their vehicle was hit by a landslide in Sigdi Balan on Saturday. ‚ÄúA 10-seater MUV on way to Kishtwar from Sigdi came under a landslide near Balana resulting in injuries to all the passengers on board,‚Äù police said ‚ÄúAll injured passengers were rescued and taken to the district hospital in Kishtwar. Their condition is stable,‚Äù police said.

End of Article
